chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: This section describes the installation procedure for the SAVARA tools.

section.title: Installation Instructions
section.para: The installation instructions for the SAVARA Eclipse tools are:
Download the latest version of Eclipse JEE, from http://www.eclipse.org , and install in your environment.

Start up your Eclipse environment, and go to the Help->Install New Software.. menu item. Select the appropriate update site URL from the SAVARA Downloads page. Once the contents of the update site is available, then select the Savara and Savara Dependencies categories and follow the instructions to install them within your Eclipse environment. If wanting to generate BPEL process definitions, then you will need to obtain the BPEL editor from either JBoss Tools (
) or appropriate Eclipse update sites.

note.para:
If loading the Savara tools from the JBoss Tools update site (
), then select the SAVARA Tools , JBoss BPEL Editor and pi4soa core features from the SOA Development category. However for the most uptodate version of the Savara tools, it is recommended to load them from the Savara update site.

section.title: Importing Samples into Eclipse
section.para: For the purpose of the Getting Started Guide, we will be using the Purchasing example located here:
Once the SAVARA Eclipse Tool distribution has been correctly installed, and the example zip downloaded, then use the following steps to import the project:

listitem.para: Select the 'Import...' menu item, associated with the popup menu on the background of the left panal (Navigator or Package depending on perspective being viewed).
When the import dialog appears, select the General->ExistingProject from Workspace option and press the 'Next' button.

Ensuring that the 'Select archive file' radio button is selected, press the 'Browse' button and locate the downloaded example zip, and then press 'Ok'. All of the Eclipse projects contained within the selected zip will be listed. Press the 'Finish' button to import them all.
